title: How did the Victorian Era end? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer is quite simple , it ended with the death of the queen herself . All the richest stge empire had accumulated during her reign and during the reign of the wise prime ministers Disraeli and Gladstone . The wise leaders were very efficient in the dealing of the empire . Moreover , being a widow , Victoria was much more engaged in running the country , as it was a deprive for her , to get away from the world. Her son Edward, though, was neither intelligent , nor did he any efficient ministers. The empire began crumbling in his reign . He rushed in his own stylish and fast paced Edwardian era , which was as different from Victorian age as beer is from champagne . His negligence to the country destroyed the reputation of the empire and he spent away all the riches of the great empire during his short reign

There are two answers: The era died with the queen in 1901. You can’t have a Victorian era without Queen Victoria.Although the queen lived on, the confident and assertive tone and atmosphere of her era died with the setbacks of the Boer Wars, especially the three major defeats of the Black Week in December, 1899. (The Battles of Stormberg, Magersfontein, and Colenso.)Although the UK won the wars, the defeats were of such a major nature to cast a doubt on the ability of the “establishment” of its day to govern effectively. Although Queen Victoria lived on, the social and political tone of the nation changed, especially as the queen’s health declined.

The Victorian age ended because of this:— The end of Queen Victoria’s reign from 1837 until her death in 1901.Queen Victoria was born in 1819, and succeeded William IV when she was age 18. She was succeeded by King Edward VII.
The Victorian era ended in 1901, when Queen Victoria of the UK died. She was replaced by King Edward VII, and so his reign is referred to as the Edwardian Era.
Queen victoria started loving solitude after her husbands death. She reduced the number of public meetings. Eventually she died.Kaput.

Because Queen Victoria died. Like all time periods we use names to describe them for convenience. In reality there was less difference between 1900 and 1910 than between 1840 and 1900. Still from a European perspective the key change was 1914–18 rather than 1901 while before Victoria the key change was the French Revolution of 1789.
